html:
The “Return to Sanctuary” event in Diablo 4 includes a host of different in-game occurrences, all of which start on Tuesday, Nov. 19, and last for different amounts of time.

Below, we’ll break down each of the major events coming to Diablo 4 for the rest of 2024, including a Spiritborn test period, the Red-Cloaked Horror, and the return of the Mother’s Blessing XP buff.

Table of Contents

  • Eternal Character boost
  • Return of the Red-Cloaked Horror
  • Limited time Spiritborn trial
  • Mother’s Blessing XP boost

Eternal Character boost

Image: Blizzard Entertainment

Starting Tuesday, Nov. 19, Diablo 4 is getting its first character boost feature, although it only applies to Eternal Realm (read: non-Seasonal) characters.

Everyone who owns Diablo 4 can boost one character to level 50, select from three different sets of Legendary Items, instantly unlock all Altars of Lilith, and pick up a host of materials like Gold and Obols. Players who own the Vessel of Hatred expansion can boost a second character this way.

While Blizzard refers to the Welcome Back Booster as a “limited-time” offering, there is no end date listed in their blog.

Return of the Red-Cloaked Horror

From Tuesday, Nov. 19, to Tuesday, Dec. 3, the Red-Cloaked Horror monster has a chance to spawn instead of a Hellborne in Helltide. It can also spawn randomly in dungeons and the Infernal Hordes mode.

The Red-Cloaked Horror can drop a variety of rewards, including the event-exclusive Gideon’s Brew, which is a powerful Elixir that increases damage done, XP earned, and materials acquired for 30 minutes.

Limited time Spiritborn trial

Image: Blizzard Entertainment

From Tuesday, Nov. 19, to Monday, Dec. 2, players who don’t own the Vessel of Hatred expansion can jump in and make a Spiritborn — Diablo 4’s sixth character class. While the trial will only be available to level up to level 25, character progress will carry over for those that eventually pick up the expansion.

If this is your first time trying the class, see our best Spiritborn build guide.

Mother’s Blessing XP boost

From Tuesday, Nov. 19, to Tuesday, Nov. 26, the Mother’s Blessing XP and gold boost will return to Diablo 4. This boost is multiplicative, meaning it stacks with other XP increases like Elixirs, making leveling up characters and increasing their Paragon level much faster during this short window.
